text:
Sourcefabric in Toronto is hiring. Full-time candidates wishing to make a difference in a start-up (30 employees). Our development platform is Linux and we use open source tools for our work. Our products are also open source, but we are well-funded, and slowly becoming self sustainable.

The Toronto office is focused on creating Airtime which is a radio automation system with a Web UI, so people all over the world can work together to control a radio station. We just won the Guardian Mega Award in London last week: http://www.sourcefabric.org/en/community/blog/1138/

To learn more about Airtime please visit: http://www.sourcefabric.org/en/airtime/

To apply, please go to http://www.sourcefabric.org/en/about/jobs/

or contact me personally at martin.konecny@sourcefabric.org
